title: [Self-Directed] Customized Mobile Microlearning Course for Gen Z Nursing Education: Mathematical Modeling-Based Instructional Design and Optimization

context.prior_knowledge: Basic nursing knowledge and professional work experience, proficiency in basic statistical analysis (mean, standard deviation, hypothesis testing) and data interpretation, and understanding of linear equations
context.additional_context: Customized curriculum for workers in their 40s and above, reflecting the characteristics of Gen Z nursing learners and the educational needs of digital native generations. Quantitatively evaluates educational effectiveness through learning data analysis and derives optimal educational strategies via mathematical modeling (optimization, simulation). Applies graph analysis and probability distribution modeling techniques for measuring educational effectiveness.

learning_goals: The learning effectiveness of educational content reflecting Gen Z learners' preference for digital environments can be analyzed using regression analysis and probabilistic models.
A linear equation and optimized nursing education process are developed to calculate efficiency (ROI) relative to learning time using mobile-based microlearning strategies.

A t-test and ANOVA statistical validation method are applied to improve educational satisfaction by 15% by implementing customized instructional methods that account for generational characteristic differences.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
